required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized Controlled Trial of Digital Diabetes Self Management Education and Support for Patients With Type 2 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Controlled Trial of a Digital Diabetes Self Management Education and Support System for Patients With Type 2 Diabetes in Primary Health Care

collaborator.agency: Medical Research Council of Southeast Sweden

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test the effect of using a digital diabetes self management education and support system compared with standard care for patients with type 2 diabetes in primary health care.

detailed_description.textblock: After being informed verbally and in text participants will sign a consent to participate. The participant will then be randomized to either use a digital diabetes self management education and support system for 10 weeks together with a diabetes nurse, or to continue with the regular care. The effects will be evaluated after 6, 12 and 36 months from randomization with emphasis on cardiovascular risk factors, life-style, diabetes knowledge and health economics.

study_design_info.masking_description: The investigator performing measurements and collecting data as well as the outcomes assessor will be blinded to group allocation.

primary_outcome.description: The level of glycated hemoglobin A1 in blood measured in mmol/mol.

other_outcome.description: Accelerometer Axivity AX3 will be used on a subgroup of 100 participants.
Indicator questions from the Swedish National Board of Health and Welfare
Questionnaire developed and validated by the National Swedish Diabetes Registry

arm_group.description: Ten-week intervention during which the participant uses a digital diabetes self management education and support system together with the diabetes nurse.
Control group continuing with regular standardized care.

intervention.intervention_name: Digital diabetes self management education and support system
intervention.description: Digital diabetes self management and support system

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type 2 diabetes mellitus diagnosed according to WHO criteria < 5 years from randomization:
- Fasting plasma glucose > 7 mmol/L at two timepoints. OR
- HbA1c ≥ 48 mmol/mol twice or in combination with fasting plasma glucose > 7 mmo/L once. OR
- Non-fasting plasma glucose ≥ 11.1 mmol/L at one timepoint in combination with symptoms of hyperglycemia.
- Access to a digital ID-card to access the digital system
- Access to a computer, tablet or smart phone
- Sufficient knowledge of written and spoken Swedish to understand the information given in the digital system.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Treatment with Insulin
- Other co-morbidities limiting the use of the digital system according to the diabetes nurse judgement. E.g. dementia or severe psychiatric disease.
- Other forms of diabetes mellitus than type 2 diabetes.

overall_official.affiliation: Region Jönköping County and Linköping University

patient_data.ipd_description: Since it is unclear to what extent this form of personal information can be transferred abroad according to Swedish law, both within and outside the European Union we do not plan to share individual patient data at the moment.
